abstracts.cdata!:
The Mexico State Judicial Modernization
            Supporting Access to Justice Project aims to support the
            improvement of institutional performance of judiciaries in a
            few states through the credit program of the National Bank
            of Works and Public Services (BANOBRAS) for state judicial
            modernization by learning while doing. In these states, the
            Project will support four components to: (a) strengthen
            institutional capabilities, organizational culture and
            knowledge diffusion; (b) strengthen efficiency and
            effectiveness of judicial services; (c) improve judicial
            transparency; and (d) increase access to justice for all
            users; as well as support Project coordination, monitoring
            and evaluation, and learning, including consultation with
            Project stakeholders. In future projects, additional state
            judiciaries would benefit. The Project would fund
            subprojects or separate projects in "participating
            states." Each of these subprojects would be complete in
            themselves, consisting of the design and implementation of
            integrated state judicial branch modernization plans
            consistent with the Project's objective.
